summary:
A geoscientist by profession, I used to look for the oil and gas you’d need to drive your cars and heat your homes. I have worked across roles from subsurface project delivery, to business planning, portfolio management, and strategy, all up to a group level. It’s afforded me the priceless opportunities to grow outside of my comfort zone in Trinidad, by taking on increasingly complex assignments in the U.K., the USA and Netherlands.

More recently, I’d moved to The Netherlands to join Shell’s Strategy Team in The Hague, as Group Portfolio Advisor, supporting the Shell Board and Executive Committee in ensuring resources are invested in the most attractive, resilient and competitive projects and assets across the Group in line with the our strategy, and in response to the Energy Transition.

Diversity & Inclusion, with a focus on sexual orientation and gender identity (LGBT+), is an area in which I am a bold and vocal advocate, both at work and in societies at large. Location permitting, I volunteer with Diversity Role Models in the UK: an education-sector charity focused on embedding inclusion, empathy and self-belief in the developing minds of minorities--truly rewarding, as well as entertaining!

school.name: University of the West Indies, St. Augustine Campus

profile_positions.description:
[Long Term International Assignment to Netherlands]

A role supporting the Shell Board, CEO, CFO & Executive Committee in ensuring our resources are invested in the most attractive, resilient and competitive projects and assets across the Group in line with our Strategy, and in response to the Energy Transition.

EXTRA-CURRICULAR: 
Group Leadership Team member of the Shell LGBT+ Global Forum, working together with the Group D&I Function and 2 Executive Committee Members (Sponsors) to advance LGBT+ inclusion globally.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Drove ~$4 bn capital re-allocation at C-Suite level through analysis and synthesis of the ~$25 bn Group Business Plan.
— Led a 15-person, cross-business team in executing a 10-day turnaround of the above from receipt of plan submission.
— Demonstrated portfolio resilience to COVID-19 interventions through iterative analysis of the 50+ country portfolio, incorporating results into the Group Strategic Risk Report (co-author) delivered to The Board.
— Influenced an update to the group’s strategic risks register and practice, resulting in increased ownership of risk parameters among the Strategy Leadership Team, and increased monitoring.
— A first in Shell’s history: directly influenced C-Suite intervention towards solving a long-felt,
significant dilemma impacting LGBT+ talent.


COMPETENCY EXPOSURE:
Cross-Business Portfolio Understanding, Exposure Management, Strategic Risks, Delivering Through Others, Project Management, Influencing Skills, Emotional Intelligence.
profile_positions.title: Group Portfolio Advisor | Strategy, Transition & Sustainability

profile_positions.description:
[Short-Term International Assignment to the UK]

A broadening role in Finance as the Business Planning lead for all of Shell’s Exploration Ventures across ten countries, and advisor/aide to the Regional VP. 

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Built and led the delivery a ~$0.3 bn regional business plan through a period of significant change, and in less than 50% of the expected time. [2019 Shell Chief Financial Officer Awards Nominee for exemplary performance in role.]
— Drove increased optimisation of $2 bn/yr capital through initiating the re-design—and subsequently leading the digitalisation, adoption and rollout of—Shell’s Global Exploration portfolio management system.
— Increased business partnering capability among the Exploration Finance Operations Team in Krakow through volunteering three Exploration ‘101’ lectures.

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Capital Allocation, Business Partnering, Portfolio Management, Business Planning, Exploration Opportunity Valuation, Change Management
profile_positions.title: Regional Exploration [Business] Planner | Europe, Russia, & Caspian

profile_positions.description:
[Long-Term International Assignment to the USA]

Exploring for [growth] business opportunities to support Shell's position in Trinidad and Tobago and the Caribbean, with regional span across 5 coutntries.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Presented a $5 bn new business opportunity to regional management after integration of multi-functional inputs.
— Led cross-functional project teams (8 to 10 people) on data room visits and evaluations, as well as in developing our regional new business technical strategy for first-mover advantage across five countries.
— As Aide to the Exploration VP, led an informal group of 10 in driving 2transformation in the South America & Africa region [ref. Shell Upstream Awards Nominee for Innovation], resulting in +2 on VP’s engagement score and a request to extend tenure.
— National Communications Chair & Deputy National President for Shell’s USA LGBT Employee Network (across nine offices nationwide).

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Data Management, Risk & Uncertainty Estimation, Converting Geology into Value, Regional Geological Evaluation, Seismic Data Interpretation, Integrated Charge Evaluation, Prospect Volume & Risking
profile_positions.title: Exploration Geoscientist | Growth & New Business Development

profile_positions.description:
[Long-Term International Assignment to the UK]

A consultant specialist geoscientist role within BG Group’s Global Exploration New Ventures 
Team providing exploration strategy and technical consultancy services and expertise to all Assets globally.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Proposed to halt a $0.2 bn investment after simulating and assessing results of 2D & 3D basin modelling work.
— Awarded best presentation (of 170+ presenters) at 2014 Schlumberger SIS Industry-Wide Conference for pioneering work in basin modelling.
— Global Network Chair of BG Pride: launched a global LGBT+ network in the UK, US, and AU, with C-Suite Sponsorship.
profile_positions.title: [Consultant] Petroleum Systems Analyst / Lead Geologist | Global Exploration & New Ventures

profile_positions.description:
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Analysed geological data to derive volume, risk, and uncertainty assessments, and proposed two competitive bid orders, creating access to 1 billion barrels of oil equivalent.
— Through data interpretation, built a 3D geocellular reservoir model over Block 5c, as well as a well plan and data acquisition programme for the Bounty-2 well.
— Turned scouting information into financial and operational synergies for Asset Leadership as Intelligence Advisor.
profile_positions.title: Geologist | New Ventures and Pre-Sanction/Appraisal @ BG Trinidad and Tobago

profile_positions.location: Reading, United Kingdom; Trinidad and Tobago
profile_positions.description:
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS:
— Volumes, risk, and uncertainty assessment on prospective Jurassic UK oil fields
— Operations and Wellsite Geologist drilling two gas wells offshore Trinidad.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Geologist at BG Group

profile_positions.description: Sub-regional prospect evaluation on Columbus Basin Pleistocene leads.
profile_positions.title: Geoscience Intern
